intro: Laserpitium fontanesii, commonly known as the alpine hawk's beard, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers, which are clustered in elongated racemes, and its hairy, basal leaves. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils at high altitudes. Laserpitium fontanesii is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
